title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation 8,
text_raw:
4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation 8, 

the following: 

“(1) A food business operator who— 

(a) 

adds to food or who uses in the manufacture of food— 

(i) 

a prohibited substance listed in Part A of Annex III to EC 
Regulation 1925/2006, or 

(ii) a restricted substance listed in Part B of Annex III to EC 
Regulation 1925/2006 in a manner contrary to the 
conditions specified therein, or 

(b) 

supplies other food business operators with food not intended for 
the final consumer or not intended for supply to retail, without 
providing information on the amount of trans fat, other than trans 
fat naturally occurring in fat of animal origin, where that amount 
exceeds 2 grams per 100 grams of fat, 

is guilty of an offence. 

(2) Notwithstanding paragraph (1) and subject to paragraph 3, a food 
business operator is not guilty of an offence under this Regulation where a food 
which was placed on the market prior to 1 April 2021— 

(a) 

contains trans fats in quantities exceeding those permitted under 
paragraph 1(a)(ii) of this Regulation and Part B of Annex III to 
EC Regulation 1925/2006, or

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

These Regulations give effect to Commission Regulation (EU) 2019/649 of 24 
April 2019 (concerning trans fats), Commission Regulation 2019/650 of 24 
April 2019 (concerning Yohimbe (Pausinystalia yohimbe (K. Schum) Pierre ex 
Beille) and Commission Regulation (EU) 2021/468 of 18 March 2021 
(concerning botanical species containing hydroxyanthracene derivatives). Those 
Regulations amend Annex III to Regulation (EC) No. 1925/2006 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council, by adding to or deleting from the lists 
of substances whose use in foods is prohibited, restricted or under Union 
scrutiny. Commission Regulation (EU) 2019/649 also introduces certain 
information requirements when food containing trans fats are supplied and 
makes provision for foods placed on the market before 1 April 2021. 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Addition of Vitamins and 
Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 
376 of 2017) in the manner specified in these Regulations. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Addition of Vitamins 
and Minerals and of Certain Other Substances to Foods) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2021.
